Mongolia 

Some of the most amazing vocalists in the world are the herdsmen of Mongolia, descendents of the warriors of Genghis Khan. They can actually sing several notes at once, imitating the sounds of nature. In this program, host Jamie Aditya emarks on an epic journey across the lakes, deserts and mountains of Mongolia to a remote legendary village called Chandaman, where this singing art was born. Along the way, a shaman, a reindeer herder, an eagle hunter and a dinosaur ranger pitch in to teach him this special art. Finally, Jamie performs his song at the Khovd Naadam village.
